page.title: 02TRADE - Markets
page.content: {THE ALFORD TUESDAY MARKET In twelve eighty three Alford had a charter to say they could have a market every Tuesday. On the eighteenth of June{1985}we went down to the market and found out a few things... There were{35 stalls}ranging from food to hosiery and clothes. There were a few plants and greengrocery stalls, some clothes and material stalls and some household spares stalls. The man who has been there the longest is called Mr E.A.Copping. He has been there for{51 {years.}He sells material and linen. He liked it during the second world war because the RAF used to be there. He says the rent per stall has gone up. It used to be{one shilling}but now it is{six pounds.}The stalls used to be made of{wood,}but now they are made of {wood and metal.
